name.japanese: モンブラン・ノーランド

keyMoments.title: Noland Trapped in Crevice
keyMoments.description: Noland remains stuck in a forest crevice while Kalgara initially threatens him, believing his crew will be executed for desecrating the gods.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Noland's vulnerability and the dangerous position he's in due to cultural misunderstanding.

keyMoments.title: Saved from Kashigami by Kalgara
keyMoments.description: When the python god Kashigami attacks Noland, Kalgara makes the ultimate sacrifice by killing it to save Noland's life.
keyMoments.significance: Proves the depth of their friendship and marks the turning point in their relationship.

keyMoments.title: Explains Tree Fever Cure
keyMoments.description: Noland reveals that Tree Fever struck his village 60 years ago and they discovered a cure using conine extracted from Kona Tree bark, explaining why he was cutting down the sacred trees.
keyMoments.significance: Vindication of Noland's actions and proof of his good intentions. Shows his medical knowledge saved two villages separated by 60 years.
keyMoments.quote: Tree Fever struck my village 60 years ago. We discovered a cure - conine from the Kona Tree bark!

keyMoments.title: Administers the Cure
keyMoments.description: Noland successfully administers the conine cure to the sick Shandian villagers, saving them from Tree Fever.
keyMoments.significance: Validates his medical knowledge and restores peace between the explorers and the Shandians.

keyMoments.title: First Sees the Golden Bell
keyMoments.description: Kalgara brings Noland to Shandora where he sees the massive golden bell for the first time - the bell whose sound guided him to the island.
keyMoments.significance: The golden bell becomes the symbol of their friendship and will later prove Noland wasn't a liar.

keyMoments.title: Learns About the Poneglyph
keyMoments.description: Kalgara shows Noland the Poneglyph that the Shandians have protected for generations, though they can no longer read it.
keyMoments.significance: Noland learns about one of the ancient Poneglyphs, connecting him to the greater mysteries of the One Piece world.

abilities.description: Noland has extensive medical knowledge, including the cure for Tree Fever using conine from Kona Tree bark.
As an explorer and botanist, Noland has deep knowledge of plants, trees, and their medicinal properties.

relationships.description: Noland and Kalgara form a deep friendship based on mutual respect and trust. Kalgara goes so far as to kill his god to save Noland's life.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara kills Kashigami to save Noland, cementing their bond beyond cultural and religious boundaries.
Kalgara shares the sacred city of Shandora with Noland, treating him as a brother.

reveals.information: Noland's village suffered from Tree Fever 60 years before his arrival on Jaya, and his people discovered the cure
Noland has medical knowledge and can create medicine from tree bark

keyMoments.title: Reveals Mousse is His Daughter
keyMoments.description: Kalgara reveals to Noland that Mousse, one of the girls who fell ill with Tree Fever, is his own daughter. He admits he was ready to let her die because of his faith in the gods.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the extreme depth of Kalgara's religious devotion and the cultural values of the Shandians. Makes his later decision to kill Kashigami even more impactful.

keyMoments.title: Kills Kashigami to Save Noland
keyMoments.description: In the most pivotal moment of his life, Kalgara kills the python god Kashigami with his spear to save Noland from being eaten. He is anguished and tearful about committing this sacrilege.
keyMoments.significance: The defining moment of Kalgara's character. He chooses friendship over lifelong religious beliefs, demonstrating the 'Great Warrior's tears' referenced in the episode title. This sacrifice shows his growth and trust in Noland.

keyMoments.title: Asks Noland to Save His Village
keyMoments.description: Despite his anguish over killing his god, Kalgara tearfully asks Noland whether he can truly save the village from Tree Fever.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Kalgara's willingness to trust in science over superstition if it means saving his people. This is his emotional breaking point.
keyMoments.quote: Can you really save my village?

keyMoments.title: Brings Noland to Shandora
keyMoments.description: With peace restored, Kalgara brings Noland to the sacred golden city of Shandora, a great honor showing the depth of their friendship.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that Kalgara now treats Noland as a true brother, allowing him to see the most sacred place of the Shandian people.

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Poneglyph
keyMoments.description: Kalgara shows Noland the Poneglyph and explains that his ancestors fought to protect it. Though they can no longer read it, they continue to guard it to honor those who died for it.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals what the Shandians have been protecting and establishes the ancestral duty that drives their culture. Connects the flashback to the greater mysteries of One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: We don't know how to read it, but our ancestors fought to protect this stone. We honor them by protecting what they died for.

keyMoments.title: Offers Gold but Protects the Bell
keyMoments.description: Kalgara tells Noland he can take all the gold from Shandora, but asks him to leave the golden bell and belfry, as they hold special cultural significance.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Shandian values - they treasure their culture and history over material wealth. Explains why the bell remains in Skypiea.
keyMoments.quote: Take the gold, all of it if you wish. But leave the belfry and the golden bell. That we must keep.

abilities.description: Kalgara is a master spearman capable of killing massive creatures like Kashigami.

relationships.description: Kalgara and Noland develop a profound friendship that transcends cultural boundaries. Kalgara ultimately chooses Noland's life over his religious beliefs.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara kills his god Kashigami to save Noland's life, the ultimate sacrifice showing their bond.
Kalgara brings Noland to sacred Shandora and shares his people's most guarded secrets.

relationships.description: Mousse is Kalgara's daughter. His willingness to let her die of Tree Fever shows his extreme devotion to religious tradition.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara reveals Mousse is his daughter and admits he was ready to let her die due to his faith.

relationships.description: Seto is also revealed to be connected to Kalgara, possibly another daughter or relative.

reveals.information: Kalgara was willing to let his own daughter die because of his faith in the gods
Kalgara is capable of questioning his beliefs and choosing reason over blind faith when lives are at stake

keyMoments.title: Blocks Villagers from Executing Noland's Crew
keyMoments.description: Seto sits in front of the cage holding Noland's crew to physically prevent the villagers from executing them. She tells the villagers they should be ashamed of themselves.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates moral courage and willingness to stand against social pressure for what's right. Shows that not all Shandians believe Noland is evil.
keyMoments.quote: You should all be ashamed of yourselves!

relationships.description: Seto befriended Noland's crew and believes in their good intentions, willing to defy her entire village to protect them.

evolutionMoments.description: Seto physically blocks the villagers from executing Noland's crew.

reveals.information: Seto has strong moral convictions and will stand up for what's right even against her entire community

keyMoments.title: Revealed as Kalgara's Daughter
keyMoments.description: Kalgara reveals to Noland that Mousse, who fell ill with Tree Fever, is his own daughter and he was willing to let her die due to his faith in divine will.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the depth of the Shandians' religious devotion and makes Kalgara's character more complex.

relationships.description: Mousse is Kalgara's daughter. She suffered from Tree Fever and was cured by Noland's medicine.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara reveals Mousse is his daughter.

reveals.information: Mousse was afflicted with Tree Fever and later cured by Noland
